comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.7.12) Gecko/20051010 Firefox/1.0.7 (Ubuntu package 1.0.7)
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.7.12) Gecko/20051010 Firefox/1.0.7 (Ubuntu package 1.0.7)

URL above contains 6 embedded videos. QT plug-in, i believe, only caches them, and perhaps only caches 1 of them. It could be indicated by:
				<PARAM NAME="controller" VALUE="false">

Whatever the resolution, mplayer should not attempt to launch multiple video streams simultaneously, or immediately next to each other.

An embedded control from that page (1 of 6):
<object classid="clsid:02BF25D5-8C17-4B23-BC80-D3488ABDDC6B"  width="110" height="17" codebase="http://www.apple.com/qtactivex/qtplugin.cab">
				<PARAM NAME="src" VALUE="http://movies.apple.com/trailers/newline/the_new_world/img/trailer_img/JPG_MOV/480_1.mov">
				<param name="href" value="http://movies.apple.com/movies/newline/the_new_world/the_new_world_480p.mov">
				<PARAM NAME="controller" VALUE="false">

				<PARAM NAME="Target" VALUE="QuickTimePlayer">
				<PARAM NAME="pluginspage" VALUE="http://www.apple.com/quicktime/download/">
				<EMBED WIDTH="110" HEIGHT="17" TARGET="QuickTimePlayer" CONTROLLER="false" SRC="http://movies.apple.com/trailers/newline/the_new_world/img/trailer_img/JPG_MOV/480_1.mov" 
				HREF="http://movies.apple.com/movies/newline/the_new_world/the_new_world_480p.mov" BGCOLOR="FFFFFF" BORDER="0" PLUGINSPAGE="http://www.apple.com/quicktime/download/">
				</EMBED>		
				</object>

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Access the URLs
2. If you don't see multiple mplayer windows popping up, go to another URL, and try again.
3.

Actual Results:  
Multipl mplayer windows pop up.

Expected Results:  
No mplayer windows apparently need to pop up, because it appears all 6 embedded movies are there only for caching, probably based on bandwidth.

Cache the best available stream? Start playing it after it's downloaded? Not sure, but not multiple windows at once.
comments.creator: haqer@gmx.fr
comments.author: haqer@gmx.fr
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.7.12) Gecko/20051010 Firefox/1.0.7 (Ubuntu package 1.0.7)
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.7.12) Gecko/20051010 Firefox/1.0.7 (Ubuntu package 1.0.7)

URL above contains 6 embedded videos. QT plug-in, i believe, only caches them, and perhaps only caches 1 of them. It could be indicated by:
				<PARAM NAME="controller" VALUE="false">

Whatever the resolution, mplayer should not attempt to launch multiple video streams simultaneously, or immediately next to each other.

An embedded control from that page (1 of 6):
<object classid="clsid:02BF25D5-8C17-4B23-BC80-D3488ABDDC6B"  width="110" height="17" codebase="http://www.apple.com/qtactivex/qtplugin.cab">
				<PARAM NAME="src" VALUE="http://movies.apple.com/trailers/newline/the_new_world/img/trailer_img/JPG_MOV/480_1.mov">
				<param name="href" value="http://movies.apple.com/movies/newline/the_new_world/the_new_world_480p.mov">
				<PARAM NAME="controller" VALUE="false">

				<PARAM NAME="Target" VALUE="QuickTimePlayer">
				<PARAM NAME="pluginspage" VALUE="http://www.apple.com/quicktime/download/">
				<EMBED WIDTH="110" HEIGHT="17" TARGET="QuickTimePlayer" CONTROLLER="false" SRC="http://movies.apple.com/trailers/newline/the_new_world/img/trailer_img/JPG_MOV/480_1.mov" 
				HREF="http://movies.apple.com/movies/newline/the_new_world/the_new_world_480p.mov" BGCOLOR="FFFFFF" BORDER="0" PLUGINSPAGE="http://www.apple.com/quicktime/download/">
				</EMBED>		
				</object>

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Access the URLs
2. If you don't see multiple mplayer windows popping up, go to another URL, and try again.
3.

Actual Results:  
Multipl mplayer windows pop up.

Expected Results:  
No mplayer windows apparently need to pop up, because it appears all 6 embedded movies are there only for caching, probably based on bandwidth.

Cache the best available stream? Start playing it after it's downloaded? Not sure, but not multiple windows at once.
This looks like a problem with the mplayer Mozilla plugin, please report this to the mplayer developers. There is nothing we can do about this.
comments.author: elmar.ludwig@uos.de
comments.creator: elmar.ludwig@uos.de
